RT @ivanabacik: The #ICPWC18 family photo - women parliamentarians from around the world today at @dublincastleopw @OireachtasNews @cathmar…
Fascinating event! https://t.co/02PNGNCpju
@campaignforleo says we should establish another Citizen’s Assembly to discuss improvements to women’s rights

Taoiseach refers to ‘sexist’ article in Constitution, re women’s place in the home. “A woman’s place is wherever she wants it to be”, says we should be careful of wording of whatever replaces the article, and cautions tying up women’s caring work with role in the home.
In the future, we should consider just be sharing for parliamentarians, like in the civil service
Taoiseach @campaignforleo borrows ‘a lot done, more do do’ mantra at #ICPW18 regarding women’s equality and how far we’ve come, saying the pace could be faster https://t.co/XGKssQLrFS
Don’t expect to be popular as a woman politician. Men will think you should be at home, letting them speak.
Gasps as @HarrietHarman says women teachers are paid 40% less than men in UK
“In 100 years we have never had a woman leader (of @UKLabour) next time, we must have a woman”
“No one is doing us a favour by letting us into parliament, we are a democratic imperative”
“That’s how it was, men made history and women made the tea” @HarrietHarman at #ICPWC18. Now there’s an expectation of equality. https://t.co/bBDYO1MHXF

“She told me she had to bully them” @cathmartingreen quoting Constance Markievicz on how she was appointed Minister for Labour in 1919, only the second woman in the world to do so #ICPWC18 https://t.co/cCSExeZXZs
All the essentials ahead of my piece from the #ICPWC18 on @morningireland shortly https://t.co/hsVWup7nhz

There was a very positive conversation about media and fake news. Says he said he got a fair hearing in the media - and that journalists were under pressure to produce stories - but none of that was reported

.@campaignforleo says he strongly believes in the work of a free press. "Yes sometimes there are tensions between government and media" "I profoundly regret if anyone thinks I don't support ...the media"

Mary-Lou is first out of the traps to ask Leo to clarify his comments re media - saying he's not interested in legitimate issues, but that he wanted to have a go. Can you tell us who attended? What else was discussed? https://t.co/PbKTJNkVs6
